Dear ___,

I am writing to provide you with a summary of your recent hospital stay from March 10, 2024, to March 12, 2024. During this period, you were under our care at ___ Hospital due to symptoms of chest pain and shortness of breath, which led to your admission.

Upon your arrival to our facility on March 10, 2024, an electrocardiogram (ECG) was performed, showing significant ST elevation in leads V5-6. These findings were consistent with an ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) involving the left main coronary artery, confirming the diagnosis on March 11, 2024.

Further evaluations included laboratory tests on March 11, where elevated levels of Troponin T were observed, measuring at 30 and 29 in two separate tests, indicating myocardial injury.

The treatment regimen aimed at addressing your acute condition included the administration of Morphine (2-4 mg as needed for pain), Oxygen therapy (2-4 L/min if oxygen saturation dropped below 90%), Nitroglycerin (0.4 mg every 5 minutes for a maximum of three doses if chest pain persisted), and a single chewable dose of Aspirin (324 mg).

During your stay, it was attempted to comply with local hospital guidelines that recommended percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). However, there were challenges in coordinating with the catheterization lab and cardio team due to communication difficulties as noted in the ward rounds documented on March 10 and 11.

By the night of March 12, your symptoms had resolved, and you expressed a desire for discharge, feeling significantly better.

Please continue to monitor your health closely and adhere to any prescribed medications or follow-up appointments. Should any symptoms recur or if you have any concerns, I urge you to seek immediate medical attention.

We appreciate the opportunity to care for you during your time of need and wish you the best in your recovery. Should you have any questions or require further information, please feel free to contact us.

Wishing you good health ahead,
